project.teaser: "BlueLightS aims at strengthening blue education in Europe to set the right conditions for the cost-effective implementation of the next Mission upscaling phase. BlueLightS will work on four axes that are central to the project's legacy by: (1) significantly increasing the...
project.objective: "BlueLightS aims at strengthening blue education in Europe to set the right conditions for the cost-effective implementation of the next Mission upscaling phase. BlueLightS will work on four axes that are central to the project's legacy by: (1) significantly increasing the number of blue challenges implemented in schools as well as the number of accredited blue schools joining the european Blue school network; (2) in coherence with the inclusiveness principles of the EU Green Deal, contributing to the diversification of blue schools, including schools from inland territories, vocational schools, schools for children and youth with disabilities...; (3) contributing to enhancing the quality and ambition of blue education projects by applying open schooling and citizenship education principles that are key to (future) citizens' engagement into blue sustainability; (4) bringing the blue education concept and vision into the (national) education system of EU Member States, mobilising education stakeholders into the co-design and experimentation of a blue education framework, as well as the development of road maps for strengthening blue education . To deliver its ambitions, BlueLightS builds on: the development and facilitation of an active blue education community of practice; the application of a strong participatory philosophy; the establishment of synergies with both Mission Ocean and EU4Ocean coalition/Network of Blue Schools processes; the integration of the blue education concept into the activities, events and communication of ""others"" at different scales; the development of well targeted comunication, dissemination and exploitation activities; the priority given to activities implemented in 9 ""experimentation"" countries representing diverse blue education maturity levels, complemented by the sharing of experiences at the lighthouse scale and support to blue schools in all EU countries."
project.title: EnLIGHTening future Schools to deliver BLUE Sustainability in Europe

article.title: Implementing blue education at European schools

category.title: Project description
category.description: Article: description of linked project written by editorial team

result.title: Plan for education, engagement and awareness activities
result.description: The report identifies a series of activities for supporting education, citizen engagement and awareness raising. It lists priorities as well as how best to connect these activities to the activites and milestones of the other WPs. (Task 5.3)

result.title: A stock taking report
result.description: Report presenting the results of the stock taking exercise on the current state of play of blue education in Europe(Task 2.1)

result.title: A plan on establishing synergies and collaboration
result.description: A report presenting opportunities for synergies and collaboration with key initiatives and networks, and proposing a road map (series of actions or criteria for identifying priority actions) that will be implemented during the duration of the project(Task 5.2)

result.title: The BlueLightS exploitation plan - V1
result.description: V1 of a report presenting the strategic, political and financing opportunities that need to be seized for bringing the project results forward, including guidance for delivering exploitation within different communities and for different products/outcomes.(Task 5.5)

result.title: The project's Data management Plan - V1
result.description: The report presents the Data Management Plan proposed for the project, with an overview of data sets used and generated, IPR associated with data sets, dataflow between WPs, procedures to make data publicly available through data repositories … The data management plan will be implemented and regularly updated during the project’s lifetime. All data will ne handled in accordance with regulation EU 2016/679 (applied to project participants from non-EU countries) on the processing of personal data.(Task 6.1)

result.title: Disssemination and communication strategy
result.description: The document presents the dissemination and communication developed for supporting BlueLightS and ensuring visibility of the project's activities and results.(Task 5.1)

result.title: The BlueEdu CoP digital
result.description: The digital platform with relevant functionalities set for supporting the management and facilitation of the Blue education community of practice (Task 1.1)

result.title: The project Ethical Charter
result.description: the document presents the ethical management charter that has been co-develped with all partners and agreed, as well as approaches that ensure its sound applications and mechanisms proposed for monitoring its application.(Task 6.1)

result.title: Plans of events, exhibitions and conferences
result.description: The report presents diffrent opportunities and priorities for organising events, exhibitions and conferences that will raise visibility and ensure the sharing of project results to different communities. It identiies events that are expected to deliver high visibility and engagement, as well as opportunities for co-organising events with parallel projects and initiatives that will bring visibility to BlueLiths in diverse communities. (Task 5.4)

result.title: A report presenting proposed experimentation in selected countries
result.description: The report presents the activities proposed in selected countries for experimenting the framework developed under WP2, accounting for the level of blue education maturity in each individual country. Countries proposing similar experimentation are identified, and possible mechanisms for establishing synergies between them proposed. (Task 3.1)

result.title: A report presenting the framework for strengthening blue education
result.description: The report will present the framework that is proposed for strengthening blue education under different cultural and educational contexts and that has emerged from the collective co-building process proposed under WP2.(Task 2.2à

result.title: Quality management plan
result.description: The report presents the internal procedures for communication, progress monitoring and quality assurance as well as the main (technical, financial and administrative) risks, the setting up of risk management procedures and of proposed contingency plan identified at the start of the project.

result.title: The project website established
result.description: The web site of BlueLights providing basic information on the project (objectives, partners, WP and activities, deliverables (public) and results) as well as links to key initiatives and paltforms - connected to the CoP digital established under WP1(Task 5.1)

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
